summary: The remaining blocking migration-ordering/deployment risk is correctly resolved by renumbering so the clawback receivables table ships with Sprint 4, and no new truly-blocking issues were introduced.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Clawback receivable table planned as a “047 addendum or included in 047” causing non-monotonic/unsafe migration ordering
previous_issues_status.notes: Now a dedicated migration exists and is cleanly placed in the monotonic sequence (048).

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Acceptance criteria mixes clawback receivables into credit-lot conservation equations without defining semantics
previous_issues_status.notes: Receivables are explicitly off-ledger IOUs with separate invariants; reconciliation checks are separated accordingly.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Sprint 6 requires transactional outbox inserts before outbox exists (Sprint 8)
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 6 uses injected IEventEmitter backed by existing in-memory BillingEventEmitter; Sprint 8.5 backfills outbox wiring.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: SQLite claim protocol used non-portable UPDATE...LIMIT RETURNING
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 8.4 specifies a SQLite-compatible select→guarded update→reselect claim flow plus concurrency tests.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Reconciliation results required for history queries but no persistence table existed
previous_issues_status.notes: Migration 052 adds reconciliation_runs and Sprint 9 AC/tests require persistence and retrieval.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Draft->pending_approval transition missing (propose creates draft but approvals expect pending_approval)
previous_issues_status.notes: submit() method/endpoint added; approve constrained to pending_approval; tests cover draft-approval rejection.
Half-open interval query, required index (account_id, finalized_at), and boundary tests are specified.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Migration numbering now implies 051 executes after 050 (Sprint 8), but Sprint 4 needs the clawback table
previous_issues_status.notes: Resolved by renumbering: clawback receivables is now migration 048 and explicitly ships with Sprint 4; subsequent migrations are renumbered to preserve monotonic ordering and release alignment.
